Title: The improvement of open journal system for successful national journal accreditation in Indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Innovative Technology and Exploring Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sundjaja, A.M., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Handoyono, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper aims to evaluate and propose improvements to the Open Journal System (OJS) based journal management to support self-evaluation of national journal accreditation. Data collection methods used were literature research, observation, documentation, and FGD (Focus Group Discussion). The evaluation method used Ms. Excel 2010 to process the empirical data into tables and graphs. Speech notes feature on Android device to change the voice (interview result) into a text. The frameworks used were the instrument of DIKTI scientific journal accreditation. The results are an audit report on the self-evaluation of national journal accreditation in BBR (Binus Business Review) journal volume 7 number 2. The audit report consists of a quality management system, user manual of OJS, and design of the journal management process using OJS. © BEIESP.
Author Keywords: Audit Report; Indonesian Journal Accreditation; Open Journal System Adoption; Process Improvement
